title.rendered: Barbados vs St Kitts and Nevis, Caribbean T20 League: Today’s Match Preview, Fantasy Cricket Tips

content.rendered:
We have opted for a fantasy cricket team based on the recent performances, overall impact, and credit points.

Pitch Report

1st innings average score: 124

2nd innings average score: 93

Type: Spinner-friendly wicket.

Time: September 21, 7.30 PM IST

Teams

Probable XI for Barbados: Rahkeem Cornwall, Kyle Mayers, Corbin Bosch, Quinton de Kock (wk), David Miller (c), Azam Khan, Jason Holder, Obed McCoy, Hayden Walsh, Mujeeb Ur Rahman, Ramon Simmonds

Probable XI for St Kitts and Nevis: Andre Fletcher (wk), Evin Lewis, Darren Bravo, Dewald Brevis, Sherfane Rutherford, Dwayne Bravo (c), Dwaine Pretorius, Rashid Khan, Duan Jansen, Akila Dananjaya, Jaden Carmichael

Form Concerns

Despite operating in the powerplay, Jaden Carmichael has picked only 1 wicket in 5 games. In his last outing, he conceded 30 runs in 3 overs.

For five consecutive games in a row, Sherfane Rutherford hasn’t got past a single-digit mark. His scores read 9, 6, 9, 7* and 0.

Game Changers

For a regular bowler, Mujeeb Ur Rahman has the best economy rate (4.50) in this edition. In the game against Guyana, he also generated 17 bonus points for his spell of 4-1-4-1.

By striking at 134, including 17 boundaries, Rakheem Cornwall has added 107 runs in 5 innings. With the ball, he has bagged 4 wickets.

Also Read:

England Women vs India Women, 2nd ODI: Fantasy Tips

Smart Picks

One way or the other, Jason Holder (86 runs and 12 wickets) and Corbin Bosch (184 runs and 1 wicket) have made a difference in fantasy leagues. Together, they have also generated 32 fantasy points by taking 8 catches each.

With three consecutive two-wicket hauls, Obed McCoy currently sits as the third-highest wicket-taker (13) of the season. He has gone wicketless only once in 8 games.

Although Rashid Khan conceded 45 runs against St Lucia, he picked 2 wickets and also contributed a handy 26 with the bat. He has taken 4 wickets in 3 matches.

After going wicketless in the first two games, Akila Dananjaya has taken 5 wickets in his last 3 matches. The conducive pitches in Guyana should keep him in the hunt.

Power Players

Kyle Mayers has been showering fantasy points through his consistent run-making (295 runs at 37). Moreover, he has also helped garner bonus points by smashing 30 fours and 18 sixes. He has been a part of the Ultimate Team on 5 occasions.

Dwayne Bravo is yet to go wicketless in this edition. When he last bowled against Barbados a few weeks ago, he finished with a two-wicket haul.

Fantasy Tip of The Day

Given the slowness of the pitch in Guyana, picking spinners from both sides could help you stay ahead in the race.
